question.content:
**Which diagram most accurately summarizes the process of cellular respiration?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

*Images created with [BioRender.com](https://biorender.com/)*

choices.clue: During cellular respiration, glucose is an input to glycolysis, and oxygen is an input to the electron transport chain. Carbon dioxide is an output of the citric acid cycle, and water is an output of the electron transport chain.
choices.content: ![A diagram shows inputs, outputs, and a process occurring in a system using arrows and labels. Outside of the system, the label glucose points to a box that points to a burst shape labeled ATP. Another arrow from the box points into the system to a circle with cycling arrows. Two arrows point out from this circle. One goes out of the system to the label C O two. The other goes to a box inside the system. Another arrow points to this box. This arrow comes from the label O two outside the system. From the box, two arrows point out of the system. One points to the label ATP, which has a burst shape around it like the other one in this diagram. Another arrow points to the label H two O.](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/982e310eebf0b9cf55f1506ccc0284c9d1c3ff3c.png)

choices.clue: In this diagram, carbon dioxide $\ce{(CO2)}$ is shown as an input of cellular respiration, and glucose is shown as an output. However, carbon dioxide is an *output* of cellular respiration, and glucose is an *input*.
choices.content: ![A diagram shows inputs, outputs, and a process occurring in a system using arrows and labels. Outside of the system, the label C O two points to a box that points to a burst shape labeled ATP. Another arrow from the box points into the system to a circle with cycling arrows. Two arrows point out from this circle. One goes out of the system to the label glucose. The other goes to a box inside the system. Another arrow points to this box. This arrow comes from the label O two outside the system. From the box, two arrows point out of the system. One points to the label ATP, which has a burst shape around it like the other one in this diagram. Another arrow points to the label H two O.](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/bdbe05ed42c78b3fac1715c699a2d8b374699176.png)

choices.clue: This diagram represents the citric acid cycle as a circle with arrows, and the electron transport chain as a box with an arrow inside the mitochondrion. So, while this diagram does show carbon dioxide $\ce{(CO2)}$ and water $\ce{(H2O)}$ as outputs of cellular respiration, it shows them as outputs of the wrong parts of the process.
choices.content: ![A diagram shows inputs, outputs, and a process occurring in a system using arrows and labels. Outside of the system, the label glucose points to a box that points to a burst shape labeled ATP. Another arrow from the box points into the system to a circle with cycling arrows. Two arrows point out from this circle. One goes out of the system to the label H two O. The other goes to a box inside the system. Another arrow points to this box. This arrow comes from the label O two outside the system. From the box, two arrows point out of the system. One points to the label ATP, which has a burst shape around it like the other one in this diagram. Another arrow points to the label C O two.](https://ka-perseus-images.s3.amazonaws.com/c2c68d47feb8a3b3ed3b36eeab7d4cc5fff94ff9.png)
